Posts.Content: Dec 27, 2012 01:50AM Lauren15 wrote: Hi all - I've been reading the posts here, as I was just diagnosed as well, and New Year's Eve is my 24th wedding anniversary and on 1/16th is the 3 year anniversary of my son's death (he was 20).  I thought after that event, I was in the clear for bad news, then this.  My general doctor was out of town and had a different one.  She basically just told me after the needle biopsy that I had cancer and to make an appt with a BS.  I had to ask for my pathology report and disect it for myself.  It's IDC Grade III with lymphovascular invasion identified.  So far I know I'm ER and PR negative on both.  The HER2 has not come back yet.  I have two different appointments on Friday with 2 surgeons to get a second opinion.  I'm really starting to flip out.  I also have a small lump behind my right ear (had it for at least 2 weeks) and forgot to tell the doctor, but now of course my mind is working overtime and thinking it's already spread.  I so don't want to give up my life and want to keep working and keep my day-to-day life going.  Have you all been able to keep it going?  I'm in need of any and all advice.  I'm so glad I found this site.  Thanks, Lauren
Posts.Title: Just Diagnosed- MerryChristmas (sarcastic) smethot Kimberly1965
